body.p: Use the ALTER INDEX statement to change the placement of an existing index and replicas among different GSI nodes.

dlentry.dd: Only users with the suitable roles of ALTER INDEX are allowed to run this directive.
This directive is applicable only for Plasma and MOI Indexes; and hence supported only for EE nodes. (Not Applicable for FDB or Views)
This directive is supported only from 5.1 onwards; if the cluster is in mix-mode, then this directive will not work.
ALTER INDEX will not work while the cluster is undergoing a Rebalance.
BUILD INDEX enforces a per-indexer-per-bucket rule by which multiple DDLs cannot be fired for the same bucket from the same node on which a build is already under progress.
String or an expression that results in a string representing the corresponding bucket name.
String or an expression that results in a string representing the corresponding index name.
Uses the Global Secondary Index as the base index.
Specifies the alter operation that needs to be performed. It is passed as-is from N1QL to GSI, where it is interpreted.
Reserved word for denoting the single action_type operation to be performed.
Moves only 1 index (or its replica) at a time to a different node.The length of the nodes array must be equal to the number of index replicas.
A node list specifying the new destination nodes for the index and its replicas. The full node list needs to be specified even if only 1 replica needs to be moved.
String or an expression that results in a string representing the node address(es).

If the ALTER INDEX fails, then:
The original indexes should continue to service the Query Scans.
The UI should reflect the original set of nodes.
A log should capture the failure along with the results.

p.note: The ALTER INDEX move operation is asynchronous. As soon as the move alter index command is executed, the command returns. If there is no error in the input, the move operation can be tracked through the console UI and any error can be found in the Console logs and Indexer logs.
Timeout is not accepted as part of the parameters since the Move Index REST API is synchronous and will complete when the move index completes.

section.title: Examples
section.p: When using the below examples, make sure Couchbase Server 5.1 is already running on the named nodes.

p.b: Example 1: Moving an index from one node to another.
Example 2: Moving an index replica from one node to another.

section.p:
Create an index on node 172.23.120.24 with a replica on node 172.23.120.25, then move its replica from node 172.23.120.25 to 172.23.120.26.CREATE INDEX idx_sched2 ON `travel-sample`(attr2) WITH {"nodes": ["172.23.120.24:8091", "172.23.120.25:8091"}
ALTER INDEX `travel-sample`.idx_sched2 WITH {"action":"move","nodes": ["172.23.120.24:8091", "172.23.120.26:8091"}
